evals.prompt: Run a CRO audit on https://allbirds.com — I want to know why our conversion rate might be low. Give me the report as an HTML file.
evals.expected_output: An HTML report file covering Homepage, Collection, PDP, Cart, and Checkout with scores, screenshots, and prioritized recommendations
assertions: The skill navigates to allbirds.com and takes screenshots
At least 4 page types are discovered and analyzed (Homepage, Collection, PDP, Cart)
Each page has a numerical score between 1-5
Findings include specific element references (not generic advice)
A prioritized action plan with quick wins and strategic items is present
An HTML file is generated and saved to the outputs folder
The report includes both desktop and mobile observations

evals.prompt: Analyze this Shopify store for conversion issues: https://gymshark.com — focus especially on mobile experience and checkout flow.
evals.expected_output: A CRO audit report with extra depth on mobile UX and checkout, including annotated observations
assertions: The skill identifies it as a Shopify store
Mobile screenshots are taken (390px viewport) for each page
Checkout page analysis includes form design, guest checkout, and payment options evaluation
Mobile-specific findings are called out (sticky CTA, tap targets, viewport issues)
The report uses the P0-P3 priority framework
Recommendations are specific enough to act on (mention colors, sizes, positions)

evals.prompt: What's wrong with this ecommerce site? https://www.everlane.com — give me the report as a PDF.
evals.expected_output: A PDF report with the full CRO audit following the LIFT model framework
assertions: The skill reads the PDF skill before generating the PDF
The audit covers all discoverable page types
The LIFT model lenses (clarity, relevance, friction, anxiety, urgency) are applied
Cross-cutting issues are identified (patterns that appear across multiple pages)
The executive summary includes an overall score and top 5 findings
A PDF file is generated and saved to the outputs folder
